title: Storytelling on the web with Snowball, a WordPress plugin for building immersive feature articles
notes:
Storytelling on the web with Snowball
		* Session facilitator: Meen Chul Kim (http://meenchulkim.info/)
		* Lead developer: Thomas H. Park (http://thomaspark.co/)
		* Project investigator: Andrea Forte (http://www.andreaforte.net/)


	1. Session objectives
		* Learn to make interactive long-form web articles with Snowball
		* Customize your website with just a dash of HTML and CSS 
		* Reimagine the future of effective storytelling on the web
	1. Introduction
		2. Motivation
			* Immersive, bespoke, interactive storytelling on the web
				* New York Times, "Snow Fall" at http://tinyurl.com/hc93r7g
				* Bloomberg, "What Is Code" at http://tinyurl.com/ofx83cx
				* Medium at https://medium.com
			* Real-world usage of WordPress as content management software
				* 25% of the entire web (https://ma.tt/2015/11/seventy-five-to-go/)
				* 11% of top newspapers and 68% of college newspapers (http://tinyurl.com/jtr2swz)
		2. Design rationale
			* Developed as an open source tool, integrating learning experiences within existing tools and practices
			* Building articles with blocks
				* Breakdown of articles into component blocks
				* Bridging the gap between WYSIWYG and code
	1. Activities
		2. Install Snowball (or use our test instance)
		2. Create an article using blocks of multiple types
			* Basics: text, image, splash, sidenote, and quote
				* Sample image: https://static.pexels.com/photos/68085/pexels-photo-68085.jpeg
			* Advanced blocks: media, social, and data
		2. Customize with code editor or settings
		2. Exercise
			* Free HD photos: Unsplash at https://unsplash.com/
